etymology.description: Simplified form of 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") -> used as a radical in conjunction with other components
etymology.interpretation: 辶(辵) (chuò, "walk") is derived by simplifying 能(mp) (néng, "self-reliant") structure from the character 辵. This simplified form emphasizes the act of motion or walking and is widely used as a radical in various motion-related characters.

examples.chinese: 学习汉字时(學習漢字時)，辶作为部首出现(辶作為部首出現)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí hànzì shí(學習漢字時)，chuò zuòwéi bùshǒu chūxiàn(辶作為部首出現)。
examples.english: When studying Chinese characters, '辶' appears as a radical.

examples.chinese: 许多表示走路的字(許多表示走路的字)，都含有辶这一部分(都含有辶這一部分)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō biǎoshì zǒulù de zì(許多表示走路的字)，dōu hányǒu chuò zhè yī bùfen(都含有辶這一部分)。
examples.english: Many characters that denote walking contain the radical '辶'.

examples.chinese: 古人写字时(古人寫字時)，常利用辶表达行走之意(常利用辶表達行走之意)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén xiězì shí(古人寫字時)，cháng lìyòng chuò biǎodá xíngzǒu zhī yì(常利用辶表達行走之意)。
examples.english: When ancient people wrote characters, they often used '辶' to express the idea of walking.
